results.title: Doctor De Soto
results.creator_credit: Michael Sporn, Morton Schindel and Weston Woods Studios
results.brief_description: Doctor De Soto, a mouse dentist, refuses to treat animals “dangerous” to mice, until one day a fox shows up writhing in pain from a toothache. How Doctor De Soto and his assistant, Mrs. De Soto “outfox the fox” is a humorous story.

results.title: Decasia
results.brief_description: This mesmerising experimental film was originally conceived as a live performance in which a fifty-five piece orchestra performed an avant-garde symphony written by Michael Gordon accompanied by large-scale film and slide projections by Bill Morrison. Morrison extends his original concept in ‘Decasia’ using recordings of the original performances by the Basel Sinfonietta that took place in Switzerland in 2001 as the soundtrack to the film. The film consists of a series of excerpts from badly deteriorated nitrate film drawn from film archives across the United States. Streaked, misted, solarised, bubbled and speckled by blooms of chemical disintegration, the footage covers a wide range of subject matter including imagery of war, progress, colonisation and everyday life. Manipulating the distorted images further through slow motion, strobing and morphing, Morrison creates a hallucinatory canvas where the documentary footage that was intended to provide a permanent record of historical moments for posterity, is swallowed by the decay that has overtaken the nitrate stock. Like the progress of a deadly virus as seen under a microscope, the decay distorts and consumes the images in a haunting, mysterious and beautiful dance of destruction. A meditation on mortality and the ephemeral nature of corporeality, history, and the endeavors of humankind. For further information go to http://www.decasia.com

results.title: Danzon
results.creator_credit: Maria Novaro, Jorge Sanchez, Instituto Mexicano de Cinematografia, Tabasco Films and Television Espanola
results.brief_description: A light-hearted romantic tale about thirty-something Julia (Maria Rojo), a telephone operator and single mother of a 15-year-old daughter living in Mexico City whose passion is dancing the “danzon”, a ballroom dance with its origins in Haiti and which spread across to Cuba during the mid-1800s, finally finding its way to Mexico several years later. Mexico in fact celebrated the 100th anniversary of the danzon in the 1990s. Sensual and seductive, danzon expresses the unspoken relationship which exists between the dancing partners, where “the man commands and the woman obeys; the man seduces and the woman shines” and for Julia, when Carmelo (Daniel Rergis), her suave and elegant dancing partner of ten years, mysteriously disappears one night, life suddenly becomes meaningless. Julia sets out determinedly to find Carmelo, following a trail of clues to Vera Cruz where she encounters an eclectic mix of new friends including a motherly hotel manager with an acerbic tongue, a prostitute with a young baby, and a transvestite named Susy (Tito Vasconcelos). This journey of self-discovery, of old loves and new loves, twists and turns gently to the tune of the rhythmic Mexican music and the sensually tantalising dancing of the danzon. Maria Novaro (Lola, 1989) is one of Mexico’s most successful women film directors and is not only renowned for her feminist approach but is also considered an “expressionist” director for the use of colors as an important feature in her filmmaking. “Danzon” appeared in the Cannes Film Festival Official Selection for 1991. Cast also includes Carmen Salinas, Margarita Isabel, Victor Carpinteiro, Cheli Godinez. Original music by Agustin Lara, Pepe Luis, Felipe Perez, Consuelo Velazquez.

results.title: Cul-de-Sac
results.creator_credit: Roman Polanski, Gene Gutowski and Compton
results.brief_description: Two wounded gangsters on the run descend upon a retired businessman living like a hermit with his young, bored and flirtatious French wife in an old castle on Holy Island, off the Northumberland coast. The arrival of the gangsters disrupts the couple’s eccentric relationship. (Awards: Winner of the Golden Bear at the Berlin Film Festival, 1966) Cast includes Donald Pleasence, Francoise Dorleac, Jacqueline Bisset, Lionel Stander and Jack MacGowran.

results.title: Clara Gibbings
results.creator_credit: F.W. Thring and Efftee Film Productions
results.brief_description: This production was adapted from the play of the same name and remained basically a filmed stage play. Dorothy Brunton plays Clara Gibbings, the proprietor of a London pub, who discovers that she is the legitimate but abandoned daughter of the Earl of Dunmoor. She launches herself into high society but soon grows disillusioned and decides to return to the fresh air of her own class. A young aristocrat, Errol, has meanwhile learnt to respect Clara and to see his own decadent life in a new light. Impulsively he proposes marriage and they depart for Australia.

results.title: Chungking express
results.creator_credit: Wong, Chan Yi-Kan and Jet Tone Production
results.brief_description: Director Wong Kar-Wai, working again with cinematographer Christopher Doyle brings together two loosely connected stories of unrequited love, drug smuggling, fast-food joints and melancholic cops. Revisiting his regular themes of chance vs fate and broken hearted loners, Wong Kar-Wai and Doyle (sharing his DOP duties with Lau Wai-Keung), again have created a heightened world of neon drenched cities and smokey bars, while the soundtrack repeats it’s ethereal refrain of the Mamas and the Papas California dreaming. The first story centers around the infamous Chungking mansions as a lovelorn cop, identified as No.223 (Takeshi Kaneshiro) yearns over a mysterious woman (Brigitte Lin) in dark sunglasses and a Marilyn Monroe style wig. Unbeknownst to the sombre detective, who has a peculiar nostalgic attachment to crushed canned pineapple, the woman is working on the other side of the law as a small time heroin smuggler. The second randomly linked story is set around the Midnight Express fast-food joint where cop No.663 (Tony Leung) spends most of his nights, recovering over a break up with an air hostess (Valerie Chow), unaware that the young woman who works behind the counter (Hong Kong rock star Faye Wong) is quietly infatuated with him. In Cantonese and Mandarin with English subtitles.

constellations_other.name: Wong Kar-Wai's Hollywood fingerprints
constellations_other.description: Wong Kar-wai’s modern masterpiece In The Mood For Love is a rich, romantic melodrama that follows the entangled lives of two neighbours (Tony Leung and Maggie Cheung) who develop feelings for each other after learning their spouses are having an affair.

results.title: Children of Soong Ching Ling
results.brief_description: Deals with the founding in China of orphanages and other welfare agencies to alleviate the suffering of millions of children. The social and cultural wellbeing of the children since 1948 are highlighted.

results.title: Buffalo 66
results.creator_credit: Vincent Gallo, Chris Hanley and Cinepix Film Properties
results.brief_description: Vincent Gallo made his directorial debut with this comedy drama about convict, Billy Brown, who is released from prison after serving a five year sentence for a crime he did not commit. Bitter and prone to violence, Billy is determined to convince his dysfunctional parents that he has been leading a respectable life doing top-secret CIA work. To give his story credibility, he impulsively kidnaps Layla from a tap-dancing class, forcing her to pose as his wife when he returns home for a visit. Layla strangely takes to the role with enthusiasm and remains with Billy even after the parental visit. Cast includes: Vincent Gallo, Christina Ricci, Anjelica Huston, Ben Gazzara, Kevin Corrigan, Mickey Rourke, Rosanna Arquette and Jan-Michael Vincent.

results.title: Battleship Potemkin (TEFC)
results.brief_description: This renowned Soviet feature portrays the mutiny aboard the Russian battleship Potemkin and the role of the sailors and citizens of the Port of Odessa in the abortive revolution of 1905. An epic dramatisation, it brought to the attention of the world the theories of Sergei Eisenstein, his emphasis on montage, stress on intellectual content and his treatment of the mass instead of the individual as protagonist.

results.title: Balloonatic
results.creator_credit: Buster Keaton, Edward Cline and Metro-Goldwyn-Mayer
results.brief_description: Buster Keaton stars as a city slicker who is carried into the wilderness by an errant balloon. Suitable for Mid-Upper Secondary level students.
